channel.title: Code Cleaners
channel.description:
I have about 10-20k lines of code over 100 classes, that are like this for example
[code]if (player .getInventory() .hasItemId( RED_BEAD) && player .getInventory() .hasItemId( YELLOW_BEAD) && player .getInventory() .hasItemId( BLACK_BEAD) && player .getInventory() .hasItemId( WHITE_BEAD)) { sendChat( "Excellent! Hand them over immediately", npc, player);[/code]
Now i usually use eclipse to indent my shit at times, however it doesn't put them back on their correct lines. I assume this was caused by another comitter on my svn, using an IDE that 'follows conventions' and after a length on the line it cuts the next part onto the second line. I personally think it's disgusting and looks like shit, harder to read and i don't mind if i had to scroll right to see some code further.
Is there any programs that will fix this for my whole project? cheers

item.title: Code Cleaners
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

I personally like Jacobe.

Read full topic

item.title: Code Cleaners
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“ownagesbot, post:11, topic:298211”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=394614.msg2933031#msg2933031 date=1251396834]
Netbean’s code formatter is very nice and entirely customizable, perhaps it would suit your needs?
[/quote]i love u, shame i cant say the same for netbeans…[/quote]

Really it only has improved to a usable level recently, 6.7 is very nice.

Read full topic

CTRL + SHIFT + F in eclipse should format it to the specified code format

item.title: Code Cleaners
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Personally I would say code like that shows there is a bigger issue that could be solved a lot more elegantly.
This may be total overkill, but what about defining preconditions for the method using annotations or something (not sure how capable Java is of this)?

Read full topic

idea fixes that kind of stuff for me

item.title: Code Cleaners

item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

Whats wrong with eclipse? You can customize most of its behavior and it is unlikely that you’ll find something better than a bit of tweaking will fix.

item.title: Code Cleaners

item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

I have about 10-20k lines of code over 100 classes, that are like this for example

if (player .getInventory() .hasItemId( RED_BEAD) && player .getInventory() .hasItemId( YELLOW_BEAD) && player .getInventory() .hasItemId( BLACK_BEAD) && player .getInventory() .hasItemId( WHITE_BEAD)) { sendChat( "Excellent! Hand them over immediately", npc, player);

Now i usually use eclipse to indent my shit at times, however it doesn’t put them back on their correct lines. I assume this was caused by another comitter on my svn, using an IDE that ‘follows conventions’ and after a length on the line it cuts the next part onto the second line. I personally think it’s disgusting and looks like shit, harder to read and i don’t mind if i had to scroll right to see some code further.

Is there any programs that will fix this for my whole project? cheers
